activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hannah Marie Kast

Attorney Harper states that she is okay with resetting this case.

records.addlTxt: 11:14 a.m. by Zoom. Defendant did not appear. DA Harper for the State; asked for a warrant. So ordered. Felony warrant authorized by the Court.
No special conditions.

1:30 p.m. by Zoom. Appearances: Defendant appeared in custody from the Richland County Jail. DA Jennifer Harper appeared for the State. Atty. Lisa McDougal appeared for the Defense. State asks for $500 cash bond; no contact with RC Wal-Mart. Defense requests signature bond. Court sets bond at $1000 signature but does not order the requested no contact. $1000 signature bond. Initial set for 2/4/22 at 11 a.m.
